name: Nmap
description: A free and open-source utility for network discovery and security auditing. Used for finding hosts, services, and vulnerabilities on a network.

name: Zenmap
description: The official graphical user interface (GUI) for the Nmap Security Scanner, making it easier for beginners to use Nmap's features.

name: Angry IP Scanner
description: A fast and simple cross-platform IP address and port scanner. It can scan IP ranges and gather information on each host.

name: Advanced IP Scanner
description: A reliable and free network scanner to analyze LAN. The program shows all network devices, gives you access to shared folders, and can even remotely switch computers off.

name: Netcat
description: A versatile networking utility which reads and writes data across network connections, using the TCP/IP protocol. It's a reliable back-end tool for network debugging and exploration.

name: OpenVAS
description: A full-featured, open-source vulnerability scanner that is part of the Greenbone Vulnerability Management (GVM) framework.

name: Masscan
description: An incredibly fast TCP port scanner that can scan the entire Internet in under 5 minutes, designed for large-scale network surveys.

name: Unicornscan
description: An asynchronous TCP/UDP port scanner and network discovery tool designed for accuracy, flexibility, and efficiency.

name: Ettercap
description: A comprehensive suite for man-in-the-middle attacks on LAN, featuring sniffing, content filtering, and host analysis.

name: DNSdumpster
description: A free domain research tool that can discover hosts related to a domain, providing valuable information for security assessments.

name: Metasploit Framework
description: The world's most used penetration testing framework for developing, testing, and executing exploit code against a remote target machine.

name: Cobalt Strike
description: A commercial threat emulation software for red teams, providing post-exploitation agents and covert channels to simulate advanced adversaries.

name: Empire
description: A post-exploitation framework that includes PowerShell and Python agents, used for command and control and lateral movement.

name: BeEF (Browser Exploitation Framework)
description: A penetration testing tool that focuses on the web browser, using client-side attack vectors to assess security posture.

name: Core Impact
description: A commercial penetration testing tool that allows security teams to safely exploit vulnerabilities and assess security controls.

name: Nessus
description: A widely-used vulnerability scanner from Tenable that helps identify vulnerabilities, misconfigurations, and malware.

name: QualysGuard
description: A cloud-based platform that provides vulnerability management, detection, and response (VMDR) to help organizations protect their IT assets.

name: Nexpose
description: A vulnerability scanner from Rapid7 that provides a comprehensive view of risk, helping to prioritize vulnerabilities.

name: Acunetix
description: An automated web application security scanner that helps find and fix vulnerabilities like SQL Injection and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS).

name: Burp Suite
description: An integrated platform for performing security testing of web applications, from initial mapping to finding and exploiting vulnerabilities.

name: OWASP ZAP
description: An open-source web application security scanner designed for a wide range of security experience, from developers to security professionals.

name: Wapiti
description: An open-source web application vulnerability scanner that performs 'black-box' scans without studying the source code.

name: Nikto
description: An open-source web server scanner which performs comprehensive tests for over 6700 potentially dangerous files/programs.

name: Arachni
description: A feature-rich, modular, high-performance Ruby framework aimed towards helping penetration testers and administrators evaluate the security of web applications.

name: Vega Scanner
description: An open-source web security scanner and testing platform to help you find and validate SQL Injection, Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), and other vulnerabilities.

name: Aircrack-ng
description: A complete suite of tools to assess Wi-Fi network security. It focuses on monitoring, attacking, testing, and cracking.

name: Kismet
description: A wireless network detector, sniffer, and intrusion detection system. It works with Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and other wireless protocols.

name: Wireshark
description: The worldâs foremost and widely-used network protocol analyzer. It lets you see whatâs happening on your network at a microscopic level.

name: CommView for WiFi
description: A powerful wireless network monitor and analyzer for 802.11 a/b/g/n/ac/ax networks. It captures every packet on the air to display important information.

name: Reaver
description: A tool that implements a brute force attack against Wi-Fi Protected Setup (WPS) registrar PINs to recover WPA/WPA2 passphrases.

name: John the Ripper
description: A fast password cracker, available for many operating systems. It supports hundreds of hash and cipher types.

name: Hashcat
description: The world's fastest and most advanced password recovery utility, supporting five unique modes of attack for over 300 highly-optimized hashing algorithms.

name: Hydra
description: A parallelized login cracker which supports numerous protocols to attack. It is very fast and flexible.

name: Cain & Abel
description: A password recovery tool for Microsoft OS. It recovers passwords by sniffing the network, cracking hashes using dictionary, brute-force, and cryptanalysis attacks.

name: Ophcrack
description: A free Windows password cracker based on rainbow tables. It is a very efficient implementation of rainbow tables.

name: Autopsy
description: A digital forensics platform and graphical interface to The Sleuth KitÂ® and other digital forensics tools to investigate what happened on a computer.

name: FTK Imager
description: A data preview and imaging tool that lets you quickly assess electronic evidence and create perfect copies (forensic images) of computer data.

name: Volatility
description: An open-source memory forensics framework for incident response and malware analysis, used to extract artifacts from volatile memory (RAM) samples.

name: Cuckoo Sandbox
description: An open source automated malware analysis system that runs files in an isolated environment to see what the malware does.

name: REMnux
description: A Linux toolkit for reverse-engineering and analyzing malicious software, containing a wide range of tools for examining malware.

name: PEiD
description: A tool that detects most common packers, cryptors, and compilers for PE files, useful for identifying binary obfuscation.

name: Maltego
description: An open-source intelligence (OSINT) and graphical link analysis tool for gathering and connecting information for investigative tasks.

name: Ghidra
description: A software reverse engineering (SRE) framework developed by the NSA, including a suite of full-featured, high-end software analysis tools.

name: ScoutSuite
description: An open-source multi-cloud security-auditing tool, which enables security posture assessment of cloud environments.

name: Trivy
description: A simple and comprehensive vulnerability scanner for containers and other artifacts. It detects vulnerabilities in OS packages and application dependencies.

name: Anchore
description: A container security platform that provides deep image inspection and analysis to generate a detailed bill of materials and enforce security policies.

name: CloudSploit
description: Now part of Aqua Security, it's an open-source tool for detecting security risks in cloud infrastructure accounts from AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.

name: Falco
description: A cloud-native runtime security project, the de facto Kubernetes threat detection engine. It detects unexpected application behavior and alerts on threats at runtime.
